artefact.overview: The Rural Payment Agency classification of cattle meat
artefact.licence_short_description: Licence to classify bovine carcasses at an approved slaughterhouse.
artefact.licence_overview:
You need a licence to classify bovine carcases at an approved slaughterhouse from the [Rural Payments Agency (RPA) Meat Technical Schemes.](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/home "Rural Payments Agency"){:rel="external"}

To be given a licence you must complete a test organised by the RPA Livestock & Meat Inspectorate and be a 'fit and proper person' to carry out classification. 

Classification of bovine carcases means assessing the carcass according to conformation and fat cover, which enables a meat price to be placed on the carcass.

You must classify, identify and weigh a bovine carcass within one hour of the animal being struck. In instances where automated grading techniques fail to classify the classification, identification and weighing must take place on the day of slaughter.

*[RPA]:  Rural Payments Agency
